clinical_study.brief_title: IRM Cardiaque en Respiration Libre Pour Des Patients Atteints de Dystrophinopathie sévère
clinical_study.official_title: IRM Cardiaque en Respiration Libre Pour Des Patients Atteints de Dystrophinopathie sévère

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

clinical_study.source: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical, prospective and monocentric study aiming at assessing the feasibility of fibrosis detection and quantification (and of function assessment) during MRI without breath-holds in a population of adults and children with Duchenne myopathy.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of exams correctly acquired (feasabiliy of the exam)
primary_outcome.description: Was it possible to acquire the whole examination for every patient ?

primary_outcome.measure: Number of exams allowing a qualitative assessment of images by the physician
primary_outcome.description: The image quality allows a qualitative diagnosis ?

primary_outcome.measure: Number of exams allowing a quantitative assessment of the diagnosis
primary_outcome.description: Did the image quality allow a quantitative assessment of the diagnosis ?

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of anatomic cardiac segments with significant fibrosis according to the assessment methods (conventional LGE, qualitative detection with GRICS, and quantiative measure with GRICS)
secondary_outcome.description: correlation between fibrosis information (conventional LGE, qualitative detection with GRICS, and quantiative measure with GRICS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of cardiac segments with fibrosis and/or regional dysfunction
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between fibrosis and regional function for each cardiac segment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Dystophinopathy (Duchenne or severe Becker)
- >8yo
- with social insurance
- informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- arythmia
- impossibility to undergo an MRI (pacemaker, ....)
